original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo chen po 'di'ang long ba lta  bu'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mig bcos nas myur ba kho nas theg pa chen pa'i mig @191a *// mthong bar byed la / pham pa byed pa rnams dang / mtshams med pa byad pa sems bskyed mi dgos par 'dzin pa rnams kyang byang chub la 'god par byed mod kyi; shin tu dmus long du 'dug pa 'dod chen pa ni /

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: mgon med pa rnams dang / bdag cag la sman mi dgos so //

analyzed: bud med sbrum ma bu btsa' bar 'dod na btsar mi btub pa rnams kyang sman gnod sel gyi mthus bde bar btsa' bar byed la /

translated: Just as the child is cured of its illness, in the same way, when this great Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is made into a book and kept in the homes of all sentient beings, through the power of the Mahāyāna, they will be made happy.🔽

analyzed: po 'dis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the child is made well, in the same way, when this great Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra is made into a book and placed in the homes of all sentient beings, by the power of the Mahāyāna it brings happiness, and through this great sūtra one becomes a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: pham pa byed pa rnams dang / mtshams @191b med pa byed pa sems bskyed mi dgos par 'dzin pa rnams kyang byang chub la 'god par byed de /🔽'dod chen pa shi ba dang 'dra ba ni /

analyzed: gal te 'di nas thar par 'gyur ba zhig yod na ni /
translated: If there were a way out of this,

analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa 'di mthong bas bdag cag gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //

analyzed: snyam du sems te / dam pa'i chos dbyung bar sems pa ni /

analyzed: 'bras bu che ba yin no //

original: dper na / byis pa la la shed bye nas bdag nyid shes par byed cing 'di ltar bdag ma'i mngal na 'dug pa'i tshe sman pa 'dis sngags dang sman gnod sel gyi mthus bdag gi ma bde bar byas pas na srog 'di ni /

analyzed: khyod kyi drin no //

translated: In the same way, this great sūtra, which is like a medicinal herb, can subdue those who commit the most heinous crimes and the most vicious of sinful nāgas who do not need to generate bodhicitta, and establish them in the great stage of awakening.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo chen po'i sgra gang du thos kyang rung ste /

translated: He removes the pain of desire, anger, and ignorance of all the sentient beings who live in the palace of the creator, and he makes them free from the creator.

analyzed: rngu rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i sems med de /
translated: In the same way, the other people do not think, ‘The pain of desire, anger, and ignorance will arise.’

original: de dag gi sems ni /
analyzed: de dag gi sems ni /
translated: Their minds

analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la gnas so //

analyzed: de bzhin du pham pa byed pa rnams dang / mtshams med pa'i las byed pa sems bskyed mi dgos par 'dzin pa rnams kyi'ang byang chub kyi rgyu skyed par byed de / 'dod chen pa 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: In the same way, the generation of the roots of virtue of those who commit the actions of immediate retribution, and of those who commit the actions of defeat, is not lost, even though they do not generate the thought of enlightenment.

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for those who are like the one who is about to die and has no medicine left.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / mtshan mo mun pa'i nang na dzambu'i gling pa'i sems can rnams zhing blas la sogs pa'i las bya ba la 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: dper na / mtshan mo mun pa'i nang na dzambu'i gling pa'i sems can rnams zhing blas la sogs pa'i las bya ba la 'jug pa med de /
translated: it is like this: At night, in the darkness, the beings of Jambudvīpa do not engage in activities such as plowing fields.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang mdo sde dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad thos shing bsgoms nas zhing blas byed 'dod pa'i sems can mtshan mo sdod pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo chen po'i nyi ma 'char ba la sdod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang mdo sde dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad thos shing bsgoms nas zhing blas byed 'dod pa'i sems can mtshan mo sdod pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo chen po'i nyi ma 'char ba la sdod do //
translated: In the same way, those who follow the Great Vehicle, having heard all the sūtras and samādhis and cultivated them, are like those who wish to cultivate the fields and wait for the night to pass, for the rising of the sun of the great Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra.

original: de nas mdo chen po 'di las dgongs pa'i tshig thos nas dam pa'i chos kyi gnas su las rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de nas mdo chen po 'di las dgongs pa'i tshig thos nas dam pa'i chos kyi gnas su las rtsom par byed do //
translated: Then, having heard the words of intention from this great sūtra, they will begin their work in the field of the sublime Dharma.

original: de nas zhing blas ji ltar byas pa la char chen po bab pas lo thog skye bar 'gyur la lo'ang legs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zhing blas ji ltar byas pa la char chen po bab pas lo thog skye bar 'gyur la lo'ang legs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, just as the great rain falls on the fields that have been cultivated, causing the crops to grow and the year to be bountiful,

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi zhing blas byas pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i mdo chen po'i sprin chen po las thos pa'i chos kyi char bab na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi zhing blas byas pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i mdo chen po'i sprin chen po las thos pa'i chos kyi char bab na /
translated: in the same way, when the great rain of the Dharma falls from the great cloud of the Tathāgatagarbha-sūtra on the fields that have been cultivated by the sublime Dharma,

original: rims nad rnam @193b pa brgyad las rnam par grol ba dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / yid du 'ong bar byed pa'i lung bstan pa chen po'i lo thog skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rims nad rnam @193b pa brgyad las rnam par grol ba dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / yid du 'ong bar byed pa'i lung bstan pa chen po'i lo thog skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will be free from the eight kinds of illness and will have happiness, good harvests, and a great prophecy of what is pleasing.

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo chen po las nyan thos chen po brgyad cu dpyid zla ra ba la  rnams mthar thug pa bzhin du lung bstan pa chen po'i lo thog skye ba'i mthar thug pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo chen po las nyan thos chen po brgyad cu dpyid zla ra ba la  rnams mthar thug pa bzhin du lung bstan pa chen po'i lo thog skye ba'i mthar thug pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the great arhats of the eighty-four thousand great śrāvakas in the great Mahāvaipulya Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Marvelous Dharma in the first month of spring reached the end of their lives, the great prophecy of what is pleasing will be like reaching the end of their lives.

original: 'dod chen pa ni; ma gtogs so ////
analyzed: 'dod chen pa ni; ma gtogs so ////
translated: Except for the one with great desire.

original: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa theg pa chen po'i mdo /
